Description: Use StatelessWidget when no mutable state needed
Do: StatelessWidget for presentation-only widgets
Dont: StatefulWidget for everything
Code Good: class Greeting extends StatelessWidget { const Greeting(this.name); }
Code Bad: class Greeting extends StatefulWidget // no state needed

Description: Use const constructors for compile-time optimization
Do: const for widgets with compile-time known values
Dont: Non-const for static content
Code Good: const Text('Hello World')

Description: Build method should be pure no side effects
Do: Only describe UI in build method
Dont: Trigger network calls or setState in build
Code Good: Widget build(ctx) { return Text(widget.title); }

Description: Extract separate widget classes not helper methods
Do: New widget class for reusable UI pieces
Dont: Private methods returning Widget
Code Good: class ItemCard extends StatelessWidget {}
Code Bad: Widget _buildCard() { return Card(); } // no optimization boundary

Description: Provide keys when widget identity matters
Do: Key for items in lists preserving state
Dont: Keys on every widget or none on list items
Code Good: ListView.builder(itemBuilder: (ctx i) => Item(key: ValueKey(items[i].id)))

Description: Always dispose controllers and listeners
Do: Override dispose for TextEditingController ScrollController
Dont: Skip dispose causing memory leaks
Code Good: @override void dispose() { _controller.dispose(); super.dispose(); }

Description: Debug widget tree with Flutter DevTools
Do: Use Widget Inspector for layout debugging
Dont: print statements for layout debugging
Code Good: Open DevTools > Flutter Inspector > Select Widget Mode

Description: Compose widgets instead of extending them
Do: Combine existing widgets via composition
Dont: Extend RenderBox for simple layouts
Code Good: class MyCard extends StatelessWidget { Container(child: widget.child) }

Description: Use events not method calls with BLoC
Do: Add events for state changes
Dont: Call methods directly on BLoC
Code Good: bloc.add(LoadItems())

Description: Use Cubit when events are overkill
Do: Cubit for simple state without complex events
Dont: BLoC for toggling a boolean
Code Good: class CounterCubit extends Cubit<int> { void increment() => emit(state + 1); }
Code Bad: class CounterBloc extends Bloc<Event State> // overkill

Description: Always use immutable state objects
Do: Use freezed or copyWith for state updates
Dont: Mutate state directly
Code Good: emit(state.copyWith(loading: false items: newItems))

Description: Scope state providers to feature widgets
Do: Provide BLoC at feature route level
Dont: Global BLoC for feature-specific state
Code Good: BlocProvider(create: (_) => CartBloc() child: CartPage())

Description: Use BlocSelector for granular rebuilds
Do: Select specific state fields to rebuild
Dont: BlocBuilder rebuilding on every change
Code Good: BlocSelector<MyBloc MyState String>(selector: (s) => s.title builder: ...)

Description: Abstract data sources behind Repository
Do: Repository mediates API cache database
Dont: Direct API calls from BLoC
Code Good: class UserRepo { Future<User> getUser(int id) async { return cache[id] ?? await api.getUser(id); } }

Description: Use GoRouter for declarative routing
Do: GoRouter with typed routes and deep links
Dont: Navigator.push for everything
Code Good: GoRouter(routes: [GoRoute(path: '/' builder: (ctx state) => Home())])

Description: Use ShellRoute for persistent bottom navigation
Do: ShellRoute wraps scaffold with nested nav
Dont: Recreate scaffold on each tab route
Code Good: ShellRoute(builder: (ctx state child) => ScaffoldWithNav(child: child))
Code Bad: Custom tab logic with IndexedStack manual routes

Description: Implement route guards for auth protection
Do: GoRouter redirect for authentication checks
Dont: No route protection for auth screens
Code Good: redirect: (ctx state) { if (!isLoggedIn) return '/login'; return null; }
Code Bad: No redirect unauthenticated users see protected

Description: Use typed path parameters
Do: Typed parameters with GoRouterState
Dont: Pass complex objects via route strings
Code Good: GoRoute(path: '/item/:id' builder: (ctx s) => ItemPage(id: int.parse(s.pathParameters['id']!)))

Description: Isolate expensive widgets with RepaintBoundary
Do: Wrap frequently animating widgets
Dont: Let animations trigger parent repaints
Code Good: RepaintBoundary(child: AnimatedWidget())

Description: Always use ListView.builder for lists
Do: Builder creates items lazily on demand
Dont: ListView with children for large lists
Code Good: ListView.builder(itemCount: 1000 itemBuilder: (ctx i) => Item(items[i]))

Description: Use color opacity instead of Opacity widget
Do: Set opacity on color or AnimatedOpacity
Dont: Opacity widget on complex subtrees
Code Good: Container(color: Colors.black.withOpacity(0.5))

Description: Offload heavy computation to isolate
Do: compute() for JSON parsing image processing
Dont: Heavy work on main isolate blocking UI
Code Good: final parsed = await compute(jsonDecode largeString)

Description: Always cache network images
Do: CachedNetworkImage with placeholder
Dont: Image.network without caching
Code Good: CachedNetworkImage(imageUrl: url placeholder: (ctx url) => Shimmer())

Description: Profile performance in release mode
Do: flutter run --release for perf testing
Dont: Profile in debug mode much slower
Code Good: flutter run --profile for accurate data

Description: Keep widget tree as flat as possible
Do: Reduce nesting use proper layout widgets
Dont: 20+ levels of nesting
Code Good: Row(children: [Expanded(child: Text('Hi')) Icon(Icons.star)])

Description: Use CustomScrollView with Slivers for mixed content
Do: Slivers for headers + lists + grids in one scroll
Dont: Multiple ListViews in SingleChildScrollView
Code Good: CustomScrollView(slivers: [SliverAppBar() SliverList() SliverGrid()])

Description: Use blocTest for testing BLoC transitions
Do: blocTest helper with build act expect
Dont: Manual stream testing with async gaps
Code Good: blocTest<MyBloc MyState>('loads' build: () => MyBloc(mock) act: (b) => b.add(Load()) expect: () => [Loading() Loaded()])

Description: Always pump after triggering state changes
Do: tester.pump() or pumpAndSettle() after actions
Dont: Expect changes without pumping
Code Good: await tester.tap(find.byType(Button)); await tester.pump(); expect(find.text('1') findsOneWidget);

Description: Use mocktail for mocking in tests
Do: Simple mocking without code generation
Dont: No mocking testing with real deps
Code Good: class MockRepo extends Mock implements UserRepository {}; when(() => mock.getUser(1)).thenAnswer((_) async => User.mock)

Description: Use golden tests for visual regression
Do: Generate and compare golden files
Dont: Only manual visual testing
Code Good: await expectLater(find.byType(MyWidget) matchesGoldenFile('my_widget.png'));

Description: Use integration_test for device testing
Do: Test full flows on real device/emulator
Dont: Only unit and widget tests
Code Good: testWidgets('full flow' (tester) async { app.main(); await tester.pumpAndSettle(); })

Description: Leverage Dart null safety properly
Do: Non-nullable by default add ? only when needed
Dont: Excessive use of ! operator
Code Good: final String name; // non-nullable
Code Bad: final String? name; name!.length // force unwrap

Description: Use extension methods for utility functions
Do: Extend types with domain-specific helpers
Dont: Top-level utility functions
Code Good: extension StringX on String { bool get isEmail => contains('@'); }

Description: Use sealed classes for exhaustive state
Do: Sealed class for finite state variants
Dont: Multiple boolean flags
Code Good: sealed class AuthState {} class Authenticated extends AuthState {}
Code Bad: class AuthState { bool isLoggedIn; bool isLoading; }

Description: Use Dart 3 pattern matching for exhaustive checks
Do: Use switch expressions with patterns for type-safe branching
Dont: Use if-else chains or old switch statements
Code Good: final message = switch (state) { Loading() => 'Loading...' Success(:final data) => data Error(:final msg) => msg }
Code Bad: if (state is Loading) return 'Loading'; else if (state is Success) ...

Description: Use Records for lightweight data grouping
Do: Return multiple values using records instead of custom classes
Dont: Create single-use classes for grouped return values
Code Good: (String name int age) getUser() => ('John' 30); final (name age) = getUser()
Code Bad: class UserResult { String name; int age; } UserResult getUser() => UserResult('John' 30)

Description: Use sealed classes for exhaustive state handling
Do: Define finite state variants with sealed classes
Dont: Use enum or abstract class with manual type checking
Code Good: sealed class AuthState {} class Authenticated extends AuthState { final User user; } class Unauthenticated extends AuthState {}
Code Bad: abstract class AuthState {} // compiler doesn't enforce exhaustive switch

Description: Use @riverpod annotation for code-generated providers
Do: Annotate functions/classes with @riverpod for auto-generated providers
Dont: Manually create providers with complex generic types
Code Good: @riverpod Future<List<Todo>> todos(Ref ref) async => ref.read(apiProvider).fetchTodos()

Description: Use autoDispose for providers that should clean up
Do: Let code gen handle autoDispose; use keepAlive() for persistent
Dont: Leak provider state after screen disposed
Code Good: @riverpod Future<User> user(Ref ref) async { final api = ref.read(apiProvider); return api.getUser(); } // auto-disposed
Code Bad: final userProvider = FutureProvider((ref) => ref.read(apiProvider).getUser()); // never disposed

Description: Configure go_router with proper redirect and error handling
Do: Use GoRouter with redirect guards and error builder
Dont: Use Navigator.push everywhere without routing structure
Code Good: GoRouter(routes: [GoRoute(path: '/' builder: (ctx state) => HomeScreen()) GoRoute(path: '/detail/:id' builder: (ctx state) => DetailScreen(id: state.pathParameters['id']!))]; redirect: authGuard)

Description: Use ShellRoute for persistent navigation bars
Do: Wrap tab destinations in ShellRoute for persistent scaffold
Dont: Recreate bottom nav on every route
Code Good: ShellRoute(builder: (ctx state child) => ScaffoldWithNav(child: child) routes: [GoRoute(path: '/home' builder: ...) GoRoute(path: '/profile' builder: ...)])
Code Bad: // Separate MaterialApp push for each tab; navigation bar rebuilds

Description: Use freezed for immutable state and union types
Do: Generate immutable classes with copyWith and equality
Dont: Write boilerplate equals hashCode copyWith manually
Code Good: @freezed class TodoState with _$TodoState { factory TodoState({required List<Todo> items @Default(false) bool loading}) = _TodoState; }
Code Bad: class TodoState { List<Todo> items; bool loading; TodoState({required this.items this.loading = false}); } // mutable

Description: Use injectable with get_it for code-generated DI
Do: Annotate classes with @injectable @singleton @lazySingleton
Dont: Register everything manually in get_it
Code Good: @injectable class UserRepository { final ApiClient _api; UserRepository(this._api); }

Description: Use Material 3 with ColorScheme.fromSeed
Do: Generate theme from seed color for M3 compliance
Dont: Hardcode individual colors throughout the app
Code Good: ThemeData(useMaterial3: true colorSchemeSeed: Colors.deepPurple)
Code Bad: ThemeData(primaryColor: Colors.blue accentColor: Colors.red) // M2; deprecated

Description: Use slivers for complex scrollable layouts
Do: Combine SliverAppBar SliverList SliverGrid in CustomScrollView
Dont: Nest ListView inside Column inside SingleChildScrollView
Code Good: CustomScrollView(slivers: [SliverAppBar(floating: true) SliverList(delegate: SliverChildBuilderDelegate(...))])
Code Bad: SingleChildScrollView(child: Column(children: [Container(height: 200) ListView(shrinkWrap: true physics: NeverScrollableScrollPhysics())])) // horrible

Description: Test widgets that depend on Riverpod providers
Do: Use ProviderScope with overrides for widget tests
Dont: Test with real API calls or skip widget tests
Code Good: testWidgets('shows data' (tester) async { await tester.pumpWidget(ProviderScope(overrides: [dataProvider.overrideWith((_) => mockData)] child: MaterialApp(home: MyScreen()))) })
Code Bad: // No widget tests; only manual testing

Description: Keep build methods fast and pure
Do: Extract complex widgets; avoid computation in build
Dont: Put API calls computation or side effects in build method
Code Good: Widget build(context) => Column(children: [const Header() ItemList(items: items)]); // const + extracted
Code Bad: Widget build(context) { final data = jsonDecode(heavyJson); return Column(...); } // computation in build

Description: Adapt UI for iOS and Android conventions
Do: Use Platform checks or .adaptive constructors
Dont: Use Material design on iOS where it looks wrong
Code Good: Switch.adaptive(value: v onChanged: onChanged); // native look per platform
Code Bad: Switch(value: v onChanged: onChanged); // Material switch on iOS

Description: Use Semantics widget for accessibility
Do: Wrap custom widgets with Semantics for screen reader support
Dont: Skip semantics on interactive custom widgets
Code Good: Semantics(label: 'Play video' button: true child: CustomPlayButton())
Code Bad: GestureDetector(onTap: play child: Icon(Icons.play)) // no accessibility label

Description: Implement repository pattern for data layer
Do: Abstract data sources behind repository interface
Dont: Call API directly from provider or widget
Code Good: abstract class TodoRepo { Future<List<Todo>> getAll(); } class TodoRepoImpl implements TodoRepo { final ApiClient _api; Future<List<Todo>> getAll() => _api.fetchTodos(); }
Code Bad: final todos = await Dio().get('/todos'); // API call in widget

Description: Use Result type or Either for error handling
Do: Return typed results instead of throwing exceptions
Dont: Catch Exception everywhere or let crashes propagate
Code Good: sealed class Result<T> { factory Result.success(T data) = Success; factory Result.failure(String msg) = Failure; }
Code Bad: try { return await api.fetch(); } catch (e) { print(e); return null; } // swallowed error

Description: Use extension types for zero-cost type wrappers
Do: Create type-safe wrappers without runtime overhead
Dont: Use typedef or raw types for IDs and values
Code Good: extension type UserId(String value) implements String {} void fetchUser(UserId id) { ... }
Code Bad: typedef UserId = String; // no type safety; can pass any string

Description: Use flutter_localizations for proper i18n
Do: Generate localization files from ARB
Dont: Hardcode strings in widgets
Code Good: Text(AppLocalizations.of(context)!.helloWorld)

Description: Use AsyncNotifier for async state in Riverpod
Do: Build async state with AsyncNotifier or AsyncNotifierProvider
Dont: Use FutureProvider and manually rebuild
Code Good: @riverpod class TodoList extends _$TodoList { @override Future<List<Todo>> build() => ref.read(apiProvider).fetchTodos(); Future<void> add(Todo todo) async { state = const AsyncLoading(); state = AsyncData(await ref.read(apiProvider).addTodo(todo)); } }
Code Bad: // Manual state management with FutureProvider + StateProvider
